WorkItem.Description:
On my profile page, ajax control gives JS error.
Â 
While the data in the background is being updated, the "uploading" image sticks on page and gives error.

Comments.Message: Are you uploading an avatar... that's probably the error you are recieving.

I get the same error just by clicking the Update Info button (whether I've changed any form data or not.)  The debugger pops up a dialog of "htmlfile: Unknown runtime error".  It then takes me to ScriptResource.axd, line 1311, which shows "updatePanelElement.innerHTML = rendering;" as the bad line.  Looks like the actual file is MicrosoftAjaxWebForms.js.

i also get the same error, too. 

CSK Version Beta2
Are you still getting it in RC1?
I also have this problem uploading an avator and also updating member info. I am using RC1
I get the same thing. Its only from IE7 (big surprise huh?)
Hmmm.... I am able to get it. Just take out the UpdatePanels... that should take out the error but on the other hand put in an UGLY postback.
This sounds exactly like my problem. http://www.codeplex.com/ClubStarterKit/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=9888
